title: Exploring data - student residence hall room size

content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. The sizes, in square feet, of the <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rooms in a student residence hall at a certain university are summarized in the following histogram. (a) Based on the histogram, write a few sentences describing the distribution of room size in the residence hall.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. The sizes, in square feet, of the <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> rooms in a student residence hall at a certain university are summarized in the following histogram. (a) Based on the histogram, write a few sentences describing the distribution of room size in the residence hall.

(b) Summary statistics for the sizes are given in the following table. Mean Standard Deviation Min <math alttext="Q 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Q1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Median <math alttext="Q 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Q3</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Max <math alttext="231.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>231.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="68.12" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>68.12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="134" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>134</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="174" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>174</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="253.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>253.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="292" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>292</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="315" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>315</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Determine whether there are potential outliers in the data. Then use the following grid to sketch a boxplot of room size.
(c) What characteristic of the shape of the distribution of room size is apparent from the histogram but not from the boxplot?

topic.text: 1.6: Describing the Distribution of a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
